body: The above two snippets are basic waltzes. The real net.Dial does more dancing; a) DNS resolution (I guess you always pass a literal address, so it won't be a problem), b) Non-blocking IO with runtime-integrated network poller. If (b) is related to the issue, for example, somehow the poller takes a wrong descriptor and the kernel says "hey, protocol not available", subsequent read/write ops might be fail too.
